title: Topic 2 - Basic Switch and End Device Configuration Study Guide

1. What are three ways a user can access the Cisco IOS? (6) **( S6)**
  - Console, Secure shell, Telnet
2. Describe briefly the two primary command modes. (2) **( S9)**
  - User EXEC Mode: Allows access to only limited number of basic monitoring commands
  - Privileged EXEC Mode: Allows access to all commands and features
3. Describe briefly the line and interface sub-configuration modes. (2) **( S10)**
  - Line Configuration Mode: 
    - Used to configure console, SSH, Telnet or AUX access
  - Interface Configuration Mode: 
    - Used to configure a switch port or router interface
4. What commands are used to: (8) **(S11, S12)**
  - Move from user EXEC mode to privilege EXEC mode, and vice versa?
  - USER â†’ Privileged = enable
  - Move in and out of global configuration mode?
  - Configure terminal
  - Move in and out of line configuration mode?
  - Line
  - To move from any sub-configuration mode back to:
    - Global configuration mode? Exit
    - Privilege EXEC mode? End
5. What does Context Sensitive help provide? (2) **(S15)**
  - Enables us to quickly find answers to the questions
6. What do the following HOT keys do? (12) **(S17, S18)**
  - Space = Displays the next screen
  - Enter = Displays the next line
  - Tab = Completes a partial command name entry
  - Up = Recalls the commands in the history buffer
  - Ctrl-Shift-6 = All purpose break sequence used to abort DNS lookups, traceroutes, ping, etc
  - ? = Ends the display string, returning to privileged EXEC mode
7. List the **three** device accesses that should be secured with passwords and their respective command sequences. (6) **(S21, S22)**
  - 1- User EXEC Mode, 2- Privileged EXEC Mode, 3- VTY line access
8. What does **service password-encryption** do? (2) **(S23)**
  - Encrypts all plaintext passwords
9. What is the purpose of **show running-config** command? (2) **(S23)**
  - Used to verify that the passwords on the device are encrypted

11. What command is used to save the running configuration file on to NVRAM? (2) **(S26)**
  - Copy running-config startup-config
12. What does the **reload** command do? (4) **(S27)**
  - It causes the device to briefly go offline, leading to network downtime
13. What is the purpose of IP addresses? (4) **(S29)**
  - Enables devices to locate one another and establish end-to-end communication on the internet
14. What is structure of IP called and how is it represented? (4) **(S29)**
  - The structure is called dotted decimal and its represented by 4 decimal numbers between 0 and 255
15. Define the IPv4 mask and state its purpose. (4) **(S29)**
  - An IPv4 subnet is a 32-bit that differentiates the network portion of the address from the host portion, the subnet mask determines to which subnet the device is a member
16. Define the default gateway address. (4) **(S29)**
  - The default gateway is the IP address of the router that the host will use to access remote networks, including the internet
17. What is the purpose of DHCP? (2) **(S31)**
  - DHCP enables automatic IPV4 addresses configuration for every end device that are DHCP-enabled
18. What is the purpose of configuring an IP Address and a subnet mask on SVI (VLAN 1) on a Switch? (2) **(S32)**
  - To access the switch remotely
19. What command is used to verify the end-to-end connectivity? (2) **(S33)**
  - Ping
